str2: The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, monument, memorial. From mnaomai; a memorial, i.e. Sepulchral monument.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To cut up, cut in pieces, mangle, wound. From kata and kopto; to chop down, i.e. Mangle.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
